title: Human-Centered Design
content: Human-centered design creates systems that match human capabilities. Controls should be intuitive. Displays should present information as needed. Procedures should flow logically. When systems fight human nature, humans loseâ€”and errors result.

mcq.question: A control panel layout requires operators to constantly reach across unrelated controls to perform common sequences. What's the issue?

options.B: The design doesn't match how work is actually done
options.C: Layout doesn't matter if labeled correctly
options.D: Operators should adapt to the design

mcq.explanation: Design should support natural work flow. When physical layout conflicts with task sequence, it increases workload, errors, and time. Redesigning to match work patterns is more effective than training people to work against design.
